title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<zykes-> sdumitriu: are you gouys working on a theme with bootstrap for xwiki ?  
00:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:04 <sdumitriu> zykes-: Kind of, yes  
00:05 <zykes-> eta ?  
00:05 <sdumitriu> No idea  
00:05 <sdumitriu> It's not a priority  
00:06 <sdumitriu> Oh wait, it is planned actually  
00:06 <vmassol> has quit  
00:06 <sdumitriu> Probably in 5.0 or earlier  
00:07 <fmancinelli> has quit  
00:14 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
00:14 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
00:35 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:46 <polx> has quit  
00:54 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
00:54 <polx> has quit  
00:55 <Denis> has quit

08:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <glerouge> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <glerouge> has quit  
09:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <tdelafoss> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <msmeria> has quit  
10:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <cjd> sdumitriu: are you about? I want to propose including require.js by default but I'd like to bounce it here before putting it on the list and you seem to be the resident js guru.  
10:15 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <jvelo> cjd: I'm not sdumitriu but I'd be +1 :)  
10:15 <cjd> ahh, you're familiar with it?  
10:16 <jvelo> not really  
10:16 <jvelo> but at least +1 to dig in this direction  
10:16 <jvelo> I'm getting tired of the load JSX adds to the page  
10:16 <jvelo> for the standard page there's like 10+ scripts already  
10:16 <cjd> modularized javascript seems like the only real way to expand in js  
10:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <cjd> It does have an optimization script which we could include in our build, it runs in rhino and it can compile and "link" javascript  
10:17 <jvelo> you can actually feel the weight when doing CTRL refresh, it's frustrating  
10:17 <jvelo> ok  
10:17 <cjd> indeed  
10:17 <cjd> funny that I'm using C/C++ terminology for js  
10:18 <cjd> static linking  
10:18 <jvelo> that would be interesting indeed, this + dynamic loading of on demand JSX  
10:18 <cjd> That's just optional, what's important is getting the script included so we can grow from there  
10:18 <jvelo> yep  
10:19 <jvelo> but managing JSX with it would be a huge gain  
10:19 <cjd> require(["prototype-1.7"], function($) { .....stuff that uses prototype });  
10:19 <cjd> that's kind of a nice feature  
10:19 <cjd> although it's kind of a lie because prototype b0rks the DOM tree at a low level so you can't really prevent it from having some influence  
10:19 <jvelo> not sure function($) brings anything in this case, I think prototype exports $ anyway  
10:20 <jvelo> (where jquery doesn't)  
10:20 <jvelo> yep  
10:20 <jvelo> at some point we should maybe move away from prototype  
10:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <cjd> +1 for moving away from prototype  
10:22 <cjd> and one way to do that is to write new js using require(['jquery-1.8'], function($) { ... . });  
10:22 <jvelo> yes  
10:22 <cjd> vmassol: have you any thoughts on this?  
10:22 <cjd> modular dependency injection for javascript :)  
10:23 <vmassol> cjd: sorry no thought, I don't know this domain well enough  
10:23 <vmassol> (would need to google and research it)  
10:23 <jvelo> we'll have a lot of legacy components based on prototype, but I think if we want to move away from proto we have to start writing new code differently anyway  
10:23 <vmassol> I suggest you make a proposal and explain the consequences  
10:23 <vmassol> (sounds good in general)  
10:23 <cjd> I'll try to present my research in my proposal but I'm a strong +1 at the moment  
10:23 <jvelo> not sure sdumitriu will be thrilled by moving to jqueryu  
10:24 <jvelo> I think it's important we at least discuss all those topics before starting the 5.x skin Caty proposed  
10:24 <cjd> Whether he or you or I like jQuery or not is kind of beside the point, jQuery "won the standards war" so to speak.  
10:25 <jvelo> and have a general direction of where we want to go with regards to the JS world  
10:25 <jvelo> I agree  
10:25 <vmassol> I agree cjd, now we need to see what this means for what we already have and how we would migrate/move away from it  
10:25 <vmassol> that should be part of your proposal  
10:25 <cjd> ok, I will add that  
10:26 <cjd> it's kind of out of the domain of require.js but I see that it makes sense.  
10:26 <cjd> I want to hear something from sdumitriu before putting it on the list though..  
10:26 <jvelo> there are a couple of domains prototype covers that we will likely need a replacement for  
10:26 <jvelo> - custom events  
10:26 <jvelo> - class system  
10:27 <cjd> hmm jquery doesn't let you listen for custom events?  
10:28 <jvelo> I was thinking about firing  
10:28 <jvelo> but maybe it does, I'm not a jquery expert  
10:28 <cjd> $("#myelement").trigger('fuelified');  
10:28 <cjd> $("#myelement").bind('fuelified',function(e){ ... });  
10:28 <cjd> http://fuelyourcoding.com/jquery-custom-events-they-will-rock-your-world/  
10:28 <cjd> from a quick googling  
10:28 <jvelo> ok it seems to be possible http://jamiethompson.co.uk/web/2008/06/17/publish-subscribe-with-jquery/  
10:29 <jvelo> there is one thing jQuery will bring that will be very valuable for us  
10:29 <jvelo> it's event delegation  
10:29 <jvelo> we need that since we are pulling components asynchronously from many places with the JSX system  
10:30 <cjd> While we're talking, what are your thoughts on YUICompressor vs. ClosureCompiler?  
10:30 <jvelo> and right now the best we could come up with is that components should listen to "xwiki:dom:loaded" AND "xwiki:dom:updated" to be able to handle "future elements"  
10:30 <jvelo> cjd: none :)  
10:31 <jvelo> I only have used YUICompressor  
10:31 <cjd> From what I've seen, ClosureCompiler seems to be a real validating compiler with constant folding and error messages whereas YUI is more of a minifier  
10:31 <cjd> You do get errors from YUI of course but it looks like CC is more strict  
10:35 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki

15:38 <vmassol> grrr http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Rendering/job/xwiki-rendering/1099/console  
15:40 <vmassol> removing parallel run  
16:00 <vmassol> ok works  
16:18 <polx> has quit  
16:49 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <polx> has quit  
17:10 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:12 <jvelo> vmassol: tdelafoss I will rename the holiday request app on github, ok ?  
17:13 <jvelo> too bad you've tagged it already, it means the SCM will be wrong on the tag  
17:13 <jvelo> but I think we can live with that  
17:14 <vmassol> jvelo: we have lots of apps in the contrib repo with various names  
17:14 <vmassol> there's  no real naming scheme ATM  
17:15 <vmassol> not sure we want to go through the hassle...  
17:16 <jvelo> yeah.. though this scheme is the most represented (it's what Sergiu used when importing SVN contrib projects)  
17:16 <vmassol> it's not the most represented by far  
17:16 <jvelo> but I agree it's not homogenous  
17:16 <vmassol> well  
17:16 <vmassol> there's a lot of everything  
17:16 <jvelo> it's the most represented  
17:16 <jvelo> check the bottom of the list  
17:16 <vmassol> yeah I've checked the 66  
17:16 <jvelo> maybe not by a lot  
17:17 <vmassol> lots of plugins-  
17:17 <jvelo> it's true  
17:17 <vmassol> macro-  
17:17 <jvelo> macro- something is the same scheme  
17:17 <vmassol> extension-  
17:17 <vmassol> module  
17:17 <vmassol> xwiki  
17:17 <vmassol> and then the odd https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/Datanucleus-Cassandra-Plugin ;)  
17:17 <jvelo> :)  
17:18 <jvelo> this is a fork I believe  
17:18 <vmassol> as you want anyway  
17:18 <jvelo> I don't mind too much TBH  
17:18 <vmassol> (we should)  
17:25 <cjd> yeah, that one is "different" in a lot of ways but it's kind of a tossup between changing everything and trying to keep with the original intent  
17:26 <jvelo> has quit  
17:34 <polx> has quit  
17:36 <Denis1> has quit  
17:37 <tdelafoss> Hi all. When I try to release my Holiday Request project with maven release:perform, it asks me for a GPG Passphrase... What should I do ?  
17:38 <cjd> If you're not trying to gpg sign it (which you won't need to if you're not putting it into maven central) then you can just hit enter if I recall correctly.  
17:39 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <tdelafoss> @cjd: That's what I tried but I got some "\*gpg: no default secret key: secret key not available     gpg: signing failed: secret key not available" error...  
17:43 <polx> has quit  
17:43 <cjd> ahh, you're using the release script from the git repo?  
17:44 <tdelafoss> @cjd: yes. I guess I shouldn't ?  :)  
17:45 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
17:45 <cjd> it's fine to use that, you're just going to have to edit it and remove the reference to the gpg signing from the mvn release command  
17:45 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <tdelafoss> @cjd: ok, thanks!  
18:21 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
18:22 <cjd> Hello sdumitriu1, I'd like to propose adding require.js to xwiki by default, do you have any thoughts about it?  
18:22 <sdumitriu1> I've been thinking about it  
18:24 <cjd> What are your thoughts re moving toward jquery? jvelo and I talked about it earlier and it seems to me that jQuery has "won the standards war".  
18:24 <cjd> I'm not strongly in favor of deprecating prototype but require.js would give us a way to provide jquery to users on demand.  
18:25 <cjd> I'm weakly in favor :)  
18:27 <sdumitriu1> It's a good step forward, but backwards compatibility is going to be hard  
18:27 <sdumitriu1> I mean, we have to change all the scripts that will use it  
18:28 <cjd> indeed, I think we're going to be a bilibrary wiki for a very long time.  
18:30 <sdumitriu1> Yes, same  
18:30 <cjd> So if I were to propose  #1 include require.js by default,  #2 add jquery but only make it available via require(['jquery'] ...  would you be in favor?  
18:30 <sdumitriu1> jQuery is the de facto standard, even if it started out as the worse solution  
18:30 <sdumitriu1> Prototype is moving towards jQuery as well  
18:31 <sdumitriu1> They're using the jQuery selector engine, they introduced the on('click') syntax...  
18:31 <cjd> yeah, I never got why messing with the dom was bad until I started working with require.  
18:32 <cjd> I'd love to see prototype pulled in using require since right now it blocks the page but that'll require us to wrap all of our scripts in require() functions and break our users.  
18:32 <jvdrean1> has quit  
18:33 <sdumitriu1> Yes  
18:34 <sdumitriu1> From the start we've decided that protoype.js won't be defered at all, since we're lenient on inline scripts  
18:36 <cjd> Oh in order for require.js to work with inline scripts, it can't be deferred either. Does that work for you?  
18:38 <sdumitriu1> Not deferring require.js? Yes  
18:38 <sdumitriu1> That one's small, AFAIK  
18:38 <cjd> it's 1993 lines before minification  
18:40 <cjd> require(["jquery-1.8"],   vs.   require(["jquery"],  do you have an opinion?  
18:42 <sdumitriu1> 1.8  
18:42 <sdumitriu1> Or wait  
18:42 <sdumitriu1> Do we fetch it from a CDN, or from our own server?  
18:42 <cjd> I would say from our own server since some people might be firewalled...  
18:43 <sdumitriu1> Then use just jquery.js  
18:43 <mrvanes> has quit  
18:43 <cjd> ok  
18:44 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
18:44 <cjd> oh and should I add a #3 deprecate the usage of prototype.js in our own code in favor of jQuery ?  
18:47 <sdumitriu1> Like we do with prototype.js  
18:47 <sdumitriu1> We can upgrade on the filesystem without requiring an update of all the client scripts  
18:47 <mrvanes\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:48 <cjd> heh thought you were lagging  
18:49 <mrvanes> has quit  
18:49 <cjd> so WDYT re deprecating usage of prototype for ourselves? I am hesitent to push new paradigms on people but we probably ought to move in one direction or the other  
18:49 <sdumitriu1> No, just doing lots of stuff in parallel  
18:49 <cjd> nps  
18:50 <sdumitriu1> I'm gonna have to investigate something  
18:50 <sdumitriu1> What's jQuery's take on classes and OOP?  
18:50 <cjd> I don't know that much about it, I guess I'm kind of playing the "no opinion" role and saying "everyone else uses it"  
18:57 <sdumitriu1> Switching office, ttyl  
18:58 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
19:26 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
19:40 <Slashman> has quit  
19:41 <vmassol> tdelafoss: hi, you should use the image macro on e.x.o  
19:41 <vmassol> your images are also a bit large :)  
19:42 <vmassol> tdelafoss: there a guide actually for xwiki.org let me find it  
19:43 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide  
19:43 <vmassol> for images, see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide#HScreenshots2FImages  
19:44 <tmortagne1> has quit  
19:47 <sdumitriu> cjd: Back  
19:48 <cjd> sdumitriu: I just sent the proposal, I found a few class systems which we could easily adapt but I don't feel right about proposing a best practice without getting dirty and doing some porting first  
19:48 <cjd> http://digg.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/javascript/Class/trunk/Class.js <-- this one looks promising  
19:49 <sdumitriu> Me too  
19:49 <sdumitriu> I was going to try and port some of our widgets first  
19:49 <cjd> to requirejs or to jQuery?  
19:49 <sdumitriu> jq  
19:50 <cjd> I think either way, what I'm proposing now makes sense, we need modules and I took require.js out for a test drive and it's still here.  
19:50 <cjd> And ofc our users need jq even if we don't.  
19:53 <cjd> anyway the AMD way is to wrap everything in define() functions so using Class.js would be something like   define(['Class'], function(Class) { Class.create(...); })  
19:59 <tdelafoss> vmassol: Thanks for the doc. It is better now (images are still not exactly the good size, but it looks better nonetheless :) ), I would finish it on Monday. Good week-end!
